title: I stopped going to school when I was 10. Now, I don't know anything about mathematics. I want to learn mathematics from the beginning to advanced. How can I learn that online? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want to learn any subject from scratch you have to follow an academic route. One of the best curriculums to learn any subject you want is the British curriculum. To learn Mathematics start with Pearson Edexcel IGCSE books and then go to IAL. You can buy the books from amazon or download them online as a pdf file. All the books have problem solving questions and their answers is written at the end of the book. Start with Edexcel Mathematics A part 1 and 2. Those books will teach you everything from scratch till grade 11. Now you go to Mathematics A (Advanced) Level. Which is equivalent to grade 12. Start with Edexcel A-level Pure Mathematics 1, 2, 3 and 4, Mechanics 1, Mechanics 2, Statistics 1, Statistics 2 respectively. Then, You start with A-level Further Pure Mathematics 1, 2, and 3, Statistics 3, Mechanics 3, Decision 1 Mathematics respectively. A-level Further Pure Mathematics is equivalent to first year of undergraduate mathematics. It will take you less than 2 years to learn all of those books. If you have any doubts while learning those books you can always clear them on Google or Youtube.

I wouldn’t rely on the internet for your education in mathematics. It is because of the internet that misinformation spreads so easily. You may be fooled into believing something you find on the internet that isn’t true.
